div.l: As I haue thryes in this schorte nyght
Swyved þe myllers dought̉er bolt up right
While þᵘou as a Coward hast ben̄ a gast
Ye fals traytour͗e quoth þe myller hast
A false traytour͗e fals clerk quoth he
Thow schall be dede by goddꝰes dignyte
Who durst be so bold to dysꝑparage
My dought̉er that is com̄e of such lynage
And by the throte bolle he caught Aleyn̄
And he hente hym dyspytously agayn̄
And on the nose he smote hym with his Fyste
Doun̄ ran̄ the blody streme on his breste
And in the flore with mouth and nose to broke
They walow as ij pyggꝭes in a poke
And up they gon̄ and doun̄ ageyn̄ anon̄e
Tyll þat þe myller spurned at a stone
And doun̄ he fell bakward on his wyfe
That wyste no thynge of this stryfe
For sche was falle a slepe a lytel wyght
With Iohn þe clerk that waked had all nyght
And with þe falle oute of her slepe sche breyde
Help holycros of Bromeholme sche seyd
In manus tuas lord to þe y call
Awake Symond þe fend ys on me fall
Myn herte ys broken̄ help y nam but dede
Ther͗e lyeth one on my wombe and on myn hede
Helpe symkyn̄ for þe false clerkꝭes fyghte
This Iohn sterte up as Fast as eủer he myght
And grasped by the walles to and fro
To fynde a staffe and sche sterte up also
And knewe the estres of the house bett̉er þan̄ Iohn
And by the walles sche fond a staffe anon̄e
And sawh a lytel schymeryng of lyght
For at an one hole in schone þe mone bright
